tool.name: SnpEff download:
tool.command: #if $for_testing_only: ## in test situation, do not download anything but just put a test genome file ## where the download would put it and see if it gets picked up. ## See the tests section for the reason why we need to do this. mkdir -p temp/'$genome_version' && cp '$for_testing_only' temp/'$genome_version'/snpEffectPredictor.bin && #else: snpEff download -dataDir "\$PWD/temp" -v '$genome_version' && #end if mkdir -p '$snpeff_db.files_path' && mv temp/'$genome_version' '$snpeff_db.files_path'

param.name: genome_version
param.label: Select the annotation database you want to download (e.g. GRCh38.86, mm10 etc.)
param.help: The list of available databases can be obtained with 'SnpEff databases' tool

validator.message: A genome version name is required

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool downloads a specified database from a remote SnpEff repository. It deposits it into the history.
-------
.. class:: infomark
**The usage scenario**
Suppose you want to annoate a VCF file containing variants within mm10 version of the Mouse genome. To do this you can:
#. Download mm10 snpEff database by typing *mm10* into **Select the annotation database...** text box. #. Use **SnpEff eff** by choosing the downloaded database from the history using *Downloaded snpEff database in your history* option of the **Genome source** parameter.
@SNPEFF_IN_GALAXY_INFO@ @EXTERNAL_DOCUMENTATION@
